definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: Once grazers were around, grass would have had a significant advantage over other plants.
sentences.chinese: 一旦草食動物出現，青草將比其它植物更有優勢。

sentences.english: The objective of this experiment was to introduce the research advances on the feeding value of Caragana microphylla to herbivores.
sentences.chinese: 介紹檸條對草食動物飼用價值研究的進展。

sentences.english: Most herbivores have flat teeth for crushing plants.
sentences.chinese: 大部分草食動物的牙齒是扁的，已用來磨碎植物。

sentences.english: The Brachiosaurus was a plant eater. It ate tops of tall trees.
sentences.chinese: 腕龍是草食動物，它喫樹梢處的葉子。

sentences.english: Motts are semi-aquatic herbivores that dwell in underground mudbank burrows.
sentences.chinese: 莫特獸是半水棲的草食動物，居住在泥灘地下洞穴中。

sentences.english: The guinea pig is precious flesh holds concurrently with multipurpose herbivores.
sentences.chinese: 豚鼠是珍貴的皮肉兼用的多用途草食動物。

sentences.english: The grazers keep the grass neat, and I have no liking for unkempt grounds.
sentences.chinese: 草食動物能使草地整潔，我也不喜歡雜草叢生的草地。

sentences.english: Gorillas, which are herbivores, feed on fruit and plants.
sentences.chinese: 草食動物的大猩猩以水果和植物爲生。

definition: (bird species of China) black-faced spoonbill (Platalea minor)
reptiles/also written 爬行類|爬行类
